node.title: Biden urges parents to vaccinate their eligible children as the program gets ‘fully up and running’ next week.
node.alt: “This vaccine is safe and effective,” President Biden said on Wednesday, referring to pediatric doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine available for use in children ages 5 to 11. “So get your children vaccinated.”
node.description: President Biden said that “for parents all over this country, this is a day of relief and celebration,” adding that the vaccination program was ramping up this week with more doses being shipped out each day,
node.content: ["President Biden urged the parents of millions of children to get their newly eligible children aged 5 to 11 vaccinated against the coronavirus, touting it as a major milestone in the nation\u2019s recovery against the coronavirus pandemic.", "Mr. Biden\u2019s comments came after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention endorsed the Pfizer-BioNTech coronavirus vaccine for children aged 5 through 11. The decision was in sync with the Food and Drug Administration, which on Friday authorized emergency use of pediatric doses for the roughly 29 million children in that age group.", "\u201cFor parents all over this country, this is a day of relief and celebration,\u201d Mr. Biden said, adding that the vaccination program was ramping up this week with more doses being shipped out each day, to be \u201cfully up and running by next week.\u201d", "Immunizing children 5 to 11 is expected to prevent about 600,000 new coronavirus cases between now and March 2022. Rising immunity may reduce the chances that young children will transmit the virus to vulnerable adults in their families and communities, health officials noted. It will also probably keep schools open.", "Jeffrey D. Zients, the White House\u2019s Covid-19 response coordinator, emphasized again at a news conference earlier on Wednesday that the rollout was still emerging, promising that millions more pediatric doses would be \u201cin the air and on trucks\u201d in the next 24 hours. By next week, he said, around 20,000 sites would offer the pediatric vaccine, with more coming in the weeks after.", "Mr. Zients said that state and municipal health departments would conduct thousands of community clinics at fairgrounds, zoos and sporting events, and that schools would host thousands of their own clinics this year.", "\u201cI know many parents have been waiting for this day, but I also know some people might have some questions,\u201d Mr. Biden said, encouraging parents to speak to local doctors and community leaders about vaccination.", "The president said many of the vaccine sites would offer times at night and on weekends for parents to take their children for shots after work and after school.", "\u201cThis vaccine is safe and effective,\u201d Mr. Biden said. \u201cSo get your children vaccinated.\u201d", "One key resource was still missing from the administration\u2019s rollout: a way to find pediatric doses on vaccines.gov, the federal website that helps people locate vaccine availability near them. Asked why the administration had yet to program the site to find pediatric doses, Mr. Zients said that the site would do so by Friday.", "\u201cYou need to get the vaccines to the sites \u2014\u00a0the sites have to be ready and up and running,\u201d he said. \u201cWe\u2019ll have a threshold number of sites online by Friday.\u201d"]
